label: lem-validation-heat-kernel
name: Validation of the Heat Kernel
relations_established: Heat kernel satisfies boundary regularity conditions
natural_language_statement: If the state space $(\mathcal{X}, d_{\mathcal{X}}, \mu)$ is a Polish metric measure space with a canonical heat kernel $p_t(x, \cdot)$ that has a uniformly bounded second moment, then defining the perturbation noise measure as $\mathcal{P}_\sigma(x, \cdot) := p_{\sigma^2}(x, \cdot)$ satisfies the required axioms, provided the boundary of the valid set $\mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{valid}}$ is sufficiently regular.
assumptions: Heat kernel $p_t(x, \cdot)$ with uniformly bounded second moment
conclusion: $\mathcal{P}_\sigma(x, \cdot) := p_{\sigma^2}(x, \cdot)$ satisfies Axiom of Bounded Second Moment of Perturbation and Axiom of Boundary Regularity
full_statement_text: If the state space $(\mathcal{X}, d_{\mathcal{X}}, \mu)$ is a Polish metric measure space with a canonical heat kernel $p_t(x, \cdot)$ that has a uniformly bounded second moment, then defining the perturbation noise measure as $\mathcal{P}_\sigma(x, \cdot) := p_{\sigma^2}(x, \cdot)$ satisfies the required axioms, provided the boundary of the valid set $\mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{valid}}$ is sufficiently regular.
